intro: Amomum meghalayense, commonly known as the Meghalaya cardamom, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, native to the northeastern region of India. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces dark brown, oblong fruits that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique flavor and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and agricultural researchers.
